body.p: Governor of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Windham, Maine, native. Son of Jonathan Andrew and Nancy Green Peirce. Graduated from Bowdoin College in Brunswick, Maine, in August 1837. Married to Eliza Jones Hersey in Hingham, Massachusetts, in December 1848. Father of Charles Albion Andrew, John F. Andrew, Elizabeth Andrew, Edith Andrew, and Henry Andrew. Admitted to the bar in Massachusetts in 1840. Attorney in Boston, Massachusetts. Member of the Anti-Slavery Party of Massachusetts. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts in 1859. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1860. Governor of Massachusetts from January 6, 1861, to January 6, 1866.
